question.title: Can't get access to resource bundle in Koltin
question.body:
I'm building Android app in Kotlin and face with problem for internationalization.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Right click on src/main/res and choose Recource Bundle
  2. Fill in Create Recource Bundle window and press OK:
  3. Add variable hello and it's translations:
  4. In my App.kt import java.util.ResourceBundle, assign a value to myBundle for further use in the UI elements:
import java.util.ResourceBundle
...
val myBundle: ResourceBundle = ResourceBundle.getBundle("strings")
  1. Run app and recieve this error: java.util.MissingResourceException: Can't find bundle for base name strings, locale en_US

Also tried options like:

  • ResourceBundle.getBundle("strings_en")

  • ResourceBundle.getBundle("res/strings/strings")

  • changed file name in resource bundle to "strings_en_US.properties"

UPDATE:

  1. Add resources file to my src/main/ and copy-paste my bundle there.
  2. Code in App.kt: val myBundle: ResourceBundle = ResourceBundle.getBundle("resources.strings") and val myBundle: ResourceBundle = ResourceBundle.getBundle("org.myProj.resources.strings")

This is about an external library, but I have local resources and I don't use any external libraries. See the project structure:

But with no luck

question_comments.body: This question is similar to: Android Studio - Include ResourceBundles in Module (solution: move bundle to resources instead of res). If you believe it’s different, please edit the question, make it clear how it’s different and/or how the answers on that question are not helpful for your problem.
